word: \93Master, carest thou not that we perish?\94 . . . This despairing cry arouses Jesus from His refreshing sleep. . . . In His divine majesty He stand sin the humble vessel of the fishermen, amid the raging of the tempest, the waves breaking over the bows, and the vivid lightning playing about His calm and fearless countenance. He lifts His hand, so often employed in deeds of mercy, and says to the angry sea, \93Peace, be still.\94 The storm ceases, the heaving billows sink to rest. The clouds roll away, and the stars shine forth; the boat sits motionless upon a quiet sea. Then, turning to His disciples, Jesus rebukes them, saying, \93Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?\94
